intro: Isatis tinctoria var. pastoris, commonly known as the lesser Chinese yellow mustard, is a biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it is known for its historical use in traditional medicine and dye production. The variety pastoris is distinguished by its smaller size and less intense yellow coloration compared to the typical variety.
